#3421 Journey update. Long post.

May has been very, very busy, which is great.

After dropping my infographics for @playcambria and @playgigaverse, my DMs exploded.
Massive thanks to BEN and Dith for the support.

A bunch of projects reached out to work with me,  which means one thing:

 üëâPeople are watching

Even eyes I didn‚Äôt know that existed üëÄ

Some offered to pay me (for the first time ever!), from $50/infographic (lol, no, sorry not sorry) to more decent rates (still not quite fair for the HUGE amount of work an infographic takes), but a start. Because yes, everyone wants the best infographic for their project, but they struggle to put their money where their mouth is.

Even though 99.9% of my work is free (sometimes I get gifted after, sometimes not), it still feels good to 1) get noticed and 2) to know your worth and say NO to offers that don‚Äôt respect it. 

Besides accepting a few of those collabs, I‚Äôve also:

- Hit 3K followers. WOW still can‚Äôt believe it. Thank you
- Relaunched my YouTube channel & opened a üá™üá∏ one
- Applied for a grant (fingers crossed)
- Been trading + riding the @AbstractChain hype. Cyclopio
- Accepted a job in Web3 (Social Media Manager. Lets hope I'm good at it, lol)
- Created my own Discord server to build a gaming community (more soon)

But may is not over. WTF! And more fire games are launching soon: @PlayCalamity, @onchainheroes, @unchained_game ... and others that I really believe in, want to play, and want to create for.

All while working a full Web2 job
Going to the gym >3w with my friend @nftsasha 
And loving my amazing wife and baby girl.

Living the dream. Hope it never ends.

should founders chase the abstract hype?

was recently asked if it's worth launching a product on the green chain

it came from a founder who raised vc money in 2024 after selling their previous company for $100m+

I laid it out clearly:

abstract's xp system is great and terrible for apps at the same time

it's exciting for teams who want to get access to easy attention

they can leverage that excitement to generate revenue, show off bullish metrics to potentially close investment rounds or breathe life into dead tokens

(remember $wool once wolf game went to blast?)

teams also benefit from lightning quick feedback loops because users are very motivated to try apps and complain if they don't like a specific feature

the downside is pretty clear

many of the users are farmers and only want to get paid

when teams listen to product feedback from farmers or get excited because of inflated metrics it comes back to haunt them once incentives dry up

it comes down to one question:

how important is getting a lot of attention in today (organic or not) to your business goals over the next 6 months?

the rest is just fucking around and finding out

@huntersolaire_ i think it depends highly on the state of your app and whether you can get better deals with other chains or rely heavily on the tech side 

another potential upside is that you are taking an early bet on Abstract and if you believe it succeeds, you can benefit from it

State of fableborne

In a past few weeks I have seen a huge amount of fud regarding fableborne on twitter and discord.

A lot of people think that the game is dead and last anouncment in their discord was too vague and it didnt explain much.

So as a community member and the best player I want to answer all the question regarding season 4, tge and more from my perspective.

Firstly I will mention that 98% of team decisions were right, to this day I am unhappy only about one little thing but it will probably be resolved later.

So where does the fud comes from? The main reason why people think that game is dead is because the last season ended in december, and its been almost 5 months since then. We did have a playtest and a staking test but many people werent a part of them/they simply dont care

To answer all the questions simply, team is most probably waiting for better market condition. Now they havent said anything about tge officially but I see no other reason for them to postpone season 4 which is already fully finsihed and ready to release any day.

Kam, the founder has said many times that its important that the game recieves tier 1 cex listing, the onchain resources have already been added to the website and the staking programm is fully ready.

You have to understand that season 4 will have kingdom integration and they cannot be used without power which even further proves my points.

The team didnt make any promises regarding any dates

This is where most of the projects fuck up, they give unrealistic dates and then they fail to deliver which breaks trust.

So we have nothing else to do but wait, we already tested the season 4 build, we have tested the staking and there isnt much more to keep people entertained.

Tbh it shouldnt be the problem in the long term but knowing how fast crypto moves i see where the fud comes from and I honestly dk what more can the team do as they are in the stale mate rn. 

Hopefully this post will answer all the "fableborne is dead" questions

Jonah made quite a few posts about growing and being a creator in crypto, and while i don't agree with all the points he made, there is a good takeaway

‚Üí to build a platform here, you want to focus content on one sector, but that doesn't mean your whole attention should go there

it's a proven recipe that focusing on a niche is a great way to grow a platform on here, but the opportunity costs of ignoring other sectors is also very high

for example, crypto gaming has not been a great sector to make money all the time, it may be a nice sector to grow a platform in, but there are a lot of money making opportunities elsewhere you don't want to miss out on

personally, 90% of my personal content is about gaming, yet i'm spending a lot of time elsewhere:
- abstract
- hyperliquid eco
- mega eth
- virtuals
- memecoins in general

i don't talk about these as much, since it's not my typical content and it's not as exciting to me to make content about how to farm hyperliquid or how to get virtuals virgen points, but i'm still paying a lot of attention to them since the opportunities are too big to fade

there are two games you want to play

long-term: find a way to grow a platform, make connections and benefit from it
short-term: be nimble and ready to pivot where the attention (and therefore money) is flowing to maximize gains

thanks for coming to my weekend ted talk
